context.description: The `WenetSTT` operator provides real-time speech-to-text transcription using the WeNet toolkit. It processes streaming audio data and outputs transcription results with support for partial (incremental) results and final transcriptions.

parameter.name: modelPath
parameter.description: Path to the WeNet model directory containing model.bin and other required files.

parameter.name: sampleRate
parameter.description: The sample rate of the input audio in Hz. Default is 16000 Hz.

parameter.name: partialResultsEnabled
parameter.description: When true, the operator will emit partial (incremental) results as they become available. When false, only final results are emitted. Default is true.

parameter.name: maxLatency
parameter.description: Maximum latency in seconds for real-time transcription. Lower values reduce latency at the potential cost of accuracy. Default is 0.3 (300ms).

parameter.name: vad
parameter.description: Enable Voice Activity Detection (VAD) to automatically detect speech segments. Default is true.

parameter.name: vadSilenceThreshold
parameter.description: Silence threshold for VAD in dB. Default is -40.0 dB.

parameter.name: vadSpeechThreshold
parameter.description: Speech threshold for VAD in dB. Default is -10.0 dB.

parameter.name: maxChunkDuration
parameter.description: Maximum duration of audio chunks to process in seconds. Default is 3.0 seconds.

inputPortSet.description: Port that ingests audio chunks for real-time speech-to-text transcription. Each tuple should contain an audio data chunk and a timestamp.

outputPortSet.description: Port that produces transcription results. Each tuple contains the transcribed text, whether it's a final result, and the confidence score.
